article.headline: Rider 75, Manhattan 68
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. (AP) -- Jason Thompson scored 23 points and pulled down a career-high 20 rebounds to lead Rider to a 75-68 win over Manhattan on Friday night. Terrance Mouton added 20 points and nine rebounds for Rider (13-11, 7-7 in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), while Harris Mansell and Ryan Thompson each finished with 12 points. Devon Austin came off the bench to score a game-high 38 points for the Jaspers (12-12, 9-5), who only made 36.1 percent of their shots and committed 16 turnovers. Manhattan was in command early on and led 32-24 lead at halftime, but the Broncs started the second half with a 24-5 run, featuring nine points each by Mouton and Mansell. The Jaspers, though, rallied late as Austin scored 10 points during a 14-2 run that cut the lead to 65-64 with 3:33 to play, but they would not get any closer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
